runs.comm: goodness me, what a start! Welcome to a bouncing pitch! Dug it short, it climbs on Akmal who rises and smashes a pull away it sails high, and only just over the head of fine leg for six. Very close, but good start
much calmer here, it would be difficult not to be, but guided from back of a length outside off stump, down to third man
cracking delivery, that's the length to bowl, full but still climbing past the outside edge as it pitches and left Butt
beaten again! This time some swing outside off, full again, Butt flinches at it aimlessly outside off and it zips past the edge
three in a row now, pressure just building a fraction here, Butt advanced down the wicket but without much conviction, swished airily at nothing and the ball went through to the keeper
poor ball to finish and Butt takes advantage, short and very wide outside off, like any decent batsmen, he loves it out there, throws his arms through the line, it flies down to deep point for four
not a great start this, shoved down the leg side, rising but too wide for the umpire
oh dear, another awful ball, short, wide outside off, asking to be smashed for four, what else could Akmal do than oblige, sending it down to the cover boundary easily
finally locates a line and length, outside off, Akmal defends
good ball again, zipping off the pitch from around off stump, Akmal very comfortably pushes it towards point
this is what Bresnan is in the side to do, drop it on a line and length and build pressure
similar ball on off stump, fraction back of a length, Akmal rises with it and pushes towards cover
Akmal content to see out the over quietly, blocking solidly towards the covers
starts rather well, decent length, decent line, Butt hops back and defends. Speaking of hopping, there is a frog on the field. How lovely.
slightly shorter this time, allows Butt to rock back and flay a slightly mistimed pull towards midwicket, it's safe and he collects a couple
good from Broad, unlike the other two bowlers, he's hit his straps from the off, this one on a good length on off stump, Butt opens the face and guides it to a diving point fielder

Akmal chancing his arm, and you have to in this format, does it well, pulling a good length ball so furiously he swung himself off his feet and ended up grounded, the ball however, was sent over mid on for four
more cautious this time, clipping into the leg side for no run
slower ball, and well directed, to end the over, Akmal wasn't deceived, and checked his defensive block
top shot this, again it wasn't a great ball, nevertheless, Butt skipped down the wicket and inside the line of the ball and crashed it cross-bat through cover for four
well played again, this time quieter though, just angling it down to third man where Sidebottom fields well to keep it to one
that's the area to bowl - fullish on around off stump -  Akmal defends
oops, Bresnan drops short and wide outside off, Akmal tried to launch it over point and out the ground, but missed it entirely
better ball this time, fuller once more, tighter line, and defended
England seem unable to pitch the ball up consistently, clearly seduced by all the bounce on offer, this is short and wide begging to be dispatched, but once again Akmal swung too hard at thin air
better line this time but a fraction short, Butt skips back and deflects it to midwicket for one
good from Broad, on a length and line, and defended
really dug in short this time, you could feel it as the effort ball, it trampolined over Akmal's pull shot and the keeper could not collect cleanly
short, outside off, Butt tries to deflect it away fine to third man and <b>dropped<//b> by Kieswetter, fantastic effort, diving to his left but couldn't hold on

gone this time! Broad strikes and England really needed that. Short and Akmal tried to hook it, it climbed too much for him, got a top edge and looped gently behind the stumps to Kieswetter, who held on to a much easier chance
short again, at around off stump, it's swung away without much timing down to midwicket for a couple
who needs style and finesse, when you can do this, walk down the track and slap it down the ground horridly for four
again, not pretty, but it will do, Butt wanders down the wicket at a length ball and flings wildly at it, no timing at all but clears mid on
this time it's all wrists and delicacy, just clipped away from a fullish length to midwicket
Hafeez serenely works this off his legs to midwicket for a gentle single
this time it's on a good length and line and pushed away tamely
oh my, very short, Butt ducks under it, although he could have jumped and it would have gone over him
not the smartest cricket I've seen, having just been wided for too high a bouncer, Bresnan slips in a high bouncer, to be fair, Butt did advance down the track
looks like Bresnan has learnt his lesson, this time pitches much fuller and it's dug out to point for one
slung in low and on middle, Butt pushes it down to mid on
wow, almost some flight on this, I wasn't expecting that, Hafeez turns his wrists over it and sends it gently down to long on
Butt down on one knee and sweeping, connects well enough for a single
quicker ball this time, outside off, Hafeez advanced and strokes it beautifully though the covers for four
oh dear, Yardy under pressure from the off, this is too short and pulled hard in front of square for another boundary
better ball this time, but the damage is done and Hafeez is content to push it down the ground for one
Hafeez has no respect clearly, on the reverse sweep first ball, connects gently, tapping it to short third man
on the normal sweep this time, connects slightly better and is rewarded with a single to short fine leg
that will annoy Swann, just a fraction too short, allowed Butt to carefully sweep to deep midwicket for a single
good ball this, Swann finding pressure, flighted and spinning sharply back into Hafeez, he defended uncertainly
good ball once more, flighted well up, Hafeez down on one knee and sweeping with caution down to deep square
nicely bowled and nicely played, full, flighted, spinning away, Butt very calmly opened the face to guide it into space at cover
worked into the off side for a single
a touch leg sided, clipped off his legs for one
nicely bowled, saw Butt advancing at him, dropped it a touch shorter and rolled his fingers over the ball, Butt's slash could find no timing
good again from Collingwood, slower and gripping off the surface, Butt tries to inject some pace into the ball with a big heave outside off, but can't time it well
very good from Hafeez, driven with control, elegantly into the covers
oh dear, drop short at this pace and you will be punished, Butt murders it over midwicket and is caught... in the crowds
quicker ball from Swann first up, rushed Hafeez as he tried to get back and give himself room, forced away for a single to cover
gone! Well, that's almost come out of nowhere. Butt danced down the track and lashes it skimming to cover, where Collingwood nonchalantly takes the catch. Crucial breakthrough for England
Akmal starts calmly enough, watching this good ball carefully and pushing it towards short third man
nicely bowled, flighted outside off invitingly, Akmal stretches and defends gently into the leg side
top shot! Very good indeed, it was a fraction short outside off, Akmal got right back in his crease, waited, and then cut firmly down to the point boundary
slightly short again, and worked away for a single
well bowled and missed stumping, it was flighted outside off, Akmal skipped down and missed his leg-side flick but Kieswetter could not hold on
this time it's calmly clipped away for a single
Yardy strikes! Not the smartest of shots that from Hafeez, he walked down the wicket, Yardy saw him coming and slipped it in quicker, Hafeez slashes it to short third man who holds on

Oh no, suicide from Afridi! Pakistan are always moments away from episodes like this. Afridi pushes the ball straight to cover and sets off for a single that never existed, Akmal sends him back, Afridi stands there, and it's all over. Absolute madness and a crucial wicket for England.
this time it's worked off the inside edge down to fine leg
lovely finish to the over, and Yardy has done very well here, full and flighted, spinning away past a flashing outside edge
good from Swann, finding a touch of spin, it's worked away to midwicket for one
Akmal shapes very early to reverse sweep, connects well enough to collect a couple
good from Umar, getting deep into his crease to cut firmly a ball outside off down  to the point boundary
rotating the strike nicely, worked away to midwicket for one
Misbah content to swap the strike with Akmal, pushing into space to collect another one
Akmal keeps the strike with a well-executed sweep shot, down to square leg
a fraction short, attempted cut, not timed to point
good ball here, touch more air, Akmal defends
Akmal on the big sweep here, connects well enough to clear the infield and land one-bounce to deep midwicket
good ball here, nothing Misbah can do, but defend from the crease
arrowed in once more, Misbah sweeps without getting much of it and is rewarded with a single
slung in low and fast, Akmal stretches and defends
Broad starts well on his first ball back, on off stump and dropped to point, the batsmen set off for another dodgy run and if Pietersen's throw had hit it would have been gone
well, shortish and Akmal slaps an inelegant but effective enough pull shot down to long on, but, it's a no ball which means... free hit!
wow, did Misbah punish him there! Anticipated that Broad would go full outside off so got deep into his crease and drove off the back foot over long on for an enormous six
oh what happened here!? It looked like Misbah edge his fiddle through to the keeper, no appeal but there looked and sounded like an edge
less incident here, on a length and line and blocked away
back of a length again, on a good tight line, turned towards fine leg for one
fuller from Broad this time, Akmal gets low in his stance and swipes it from outside off down to long on for one
not great from Akmal here, gets into position to sweep very early, so that when the ball lands well outside off all he can do is tap it tamely to short fine leg
good ball again from Yardy, Misbah comes forward and defends into the off side for one
Akmal looking for something expansive, swishing this away into midwicket but can't time it
top bowling from Yardy, slung in quickly, Misbah tried to give himself room but it was on him too quickly
good again, quick and Misbah can't do anything but defend

very smart from Yardy and slightly suicidal from Misbah, he got into a reverse sweep position almost while Yardy was still running up, it left him a sitting duck for a quicker full ball which Yardy duly fired it and bowled him
Umar content to work the strike over to the danger man, Razzaq, just turning his wrists over the ball to send it to square leg
Razzaq defends his first ball into the off side
good from Swann, not giving Razzaq the width that makes him lethal, blocked away
this time he collects one in calm fashion, prodding into the off side
shot! Umar advances down the track and launches it over cow corner, simple and highly effective
good ball here, Akmal pushed it down to long on gently, and the throw came in, cannoned off the stumps and went for an overthrow. Swann looks furious
Sidebottom returns and that looks a harsh call, a touch short but not very, Razzaq had to crouch low to get under it, but it was given a wide
shortish again and aimed into the body, Razzaq tries to swing it away, gets an under edge down to fine leg. Looks like a very deliberate effort not to dare bowl length to Razzaq
outrageous shot, and very well done from Akmal. He gets down low and, watching the fine leg come up to the circle, dinks it over the fielder's head for a boundary
Sidebottom this time goes full, Akmal hung back and would have backed himself to smash it away back down the ground, but couldn't quite time it

what a catch from Pietersen! Brilliant stuff, dug in short from Sidebottom, Akmal smashed it miles in the air down to deep midwicket, Pietersen running back and around from a straightish midwicket, stuck his hands out and snaffled an excellent take
good stuff from Sidebottom here, full and Razzaq can't quite time his off-side flay and collects one
good ball once more, fullish outside off stump and driven by Alam without much timing into the off side
Broad is back, and, as he's done all game, starts well, on and around off stump, Alam swishes at nothing
gone this time, pretty similar to the last ball and Alam tried to cut, but it was too close to him, ended up edging tamely behind
Pakistan need to be careful here, just play for Razzaq who can still cause havoc, Aamer does well here, carefully angling a shortish ball away for one down to third man
very good from Broad, on a length and bang on off stump, Razzaq hops back and defends
not this time though, just hanging leg side of the ball, pushes it to point and sets off for a quick single
Aamer content to get back and angle it away down to third man, and will keep the strike
Pakistan need some big shots soon, this is short and Aamer once again attempts his off-side guide, but can't connect
England will be loving this, Razzaq marooned at the wrong end, Aamer again missing a nudge down to third man  from Sidebottom's shortish ball outside off
good from Sidebottom, Aamer seems desperate to get inside the line and push it to third man so ran outside leg to give himself room, Sidebottom followed him and he couldn't get it away
finally connects, giving himself plenty of room once again and mistimes it into the covers
much slower ball attempted, but the line goes awry, sprayed well outside off
oh dear, Sidebottom repeats the line, shoving it  miles outside off and not even Razzaq can reach it
well, that was as hideous from Sidebottom as it was brilliant from Razzaq, a gentle full toss straight into Razzaq's hitting arc, he pummelled straight back over his head for six

gone! Razzaq can't repeat the dose, another pretty gentle full toss, perhaps a bit lower this time, Razzaq tries to smash it away but gets it off the bottom of the bat and it loops out gently to long off, who gleefully takes it

well, Aamer has looked uncomfortable all innings, and this time he's gone, dug in at the body from Bresnan, Aamer skipped leg side to give himself room for a cut, it was too close to him and he ends up sending it looping to point, where Swann and Yardy almost collide taking the catch
this time it's much too wide outside off and a welcome run for Pakistan
almost gone here, Ajmal dropped it on to the off side and set off for one, there was no run there  but Bresnan's throw missed the stumps
that will do fro Ajmal, I'm not sure how much he knew about it, very little probably, short and he closed his eyes and slogged, it flew off a top edge over the keeper for a welcome boundary
pushed away into the offside, and some quick running and confused fielding allows an extra run
sloppy from Bresnan, shoved miles down the leg side for a welcome extra run and, crucially, extra ball

well, there you go! A classic tailender shot, for some reason, Bresnan banged it in short and Ajmal swiped at it, of course it didn't go where he intended, but it matters not a jot, it sailed high and handsomely over the keeper for a very welcome six

Ajmal attempting a delicate ramp/dink shot, flies off the outside edge down to third man on the bounce, and that ends an excellent final over for Pakistan which should make for a very interesting run chase
